topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack 2.0: Removing a VSA Node

p.note: Please perform this operation under the supervision of the HP support team.

body.p: This topic describes how to remove the VSA node.
You can remove the VSA storage system from the cloud after it is removed from the cluster management group in CMC. This is performed if you want to remove VSA permanently.

You must remove the VSA cluster from CMC before removing the VSA node. To remove the CMC cluster, refer to HP StoreVirtual Storage Online help in CMC for more details.You can remove a VSA node only if you have more than three nodes in a cluster.

p.b: To Remove a VSA Node from a Cloud

body.p:
Perform the following steps to remove the same cluster which has been removed from CMC in your cloud.
Edit the definition of the server (usually in the data/servers.yml file), for example: - id: vsa1 ip-addr: 192.168.61.15 role: VSA-ROLE server-group: RACK1 nic-mapping: HP-BL460c-4PORT ilo-ip: 10.1.192.232 ilo-password: gone2far ilo-user: Administrator mac-addr: 5C:B9:01:78:8C:B0
- id: vsa2 ip-addr: 192.168.61.16 role: VSA-ROLE server-group: RACK2 nic-mapping: HP-BL460c-4PORT ilo-ip: 10.1.192.233 ilo-password: gone2far ilo-user: Administrator mac-addr: 5C:B9:01:78:0E:30
- id: vsa3 ip-addr: 192.168.61.17 role: VSA-ROLE server-group: RACK3 nic-mapping: HP-BL460c-4PORT ilo-ip: 10.1.192.234 ilo-password: gone2far ilo-user: Administrator mac-addr: 5C:B9:01:78:2D:00
- id: vsa4 ip-addr: 192.168.61.18 role: VSA-ROLE server-group: RACK3 nic-mapping: HP-BL460c-4PORT ilo-ip: 10.1.192.235 ilo-password: gone2far ilo-user: Administrator mac-addr: 5C:B9:01:78:2D:00
The above example shows one cluster with four nodes. Since you have already removed the VSA cluster from CMC, now you can remove one of the nodes associated with that cluster. In the following example, servers.yml file vsa2 has been removed:- id: vsa1 ip-addr: 192.168.61.15 role: VSA-ROLE server-group: RACK1 nic-mapping: HP-BL460c-4PORT ilo-ip: 10.1.192.232 ilo-password: gone2far ilo-user: Administrator mac-addr: 5C:B9:01:78:8C:B0
- id: vsa3 ip-addr: 192.168.61.17 role: VSA-ROLE server-group: RACK3 nic-mapping: HP-BL460c-4PORT ilo-ip: 10.1.192.234 ilo-password: gone2far ilo-user: Administrator mac-addr: 5C:B9:01:78:2D:00
- id: vsa4 ip-addr: 192.168.61.18 role: VSA-ROLE server-group: RACK3 nic-mapping: HP-BL460c-4PORT ilo-ip: 10.1.192.235 ilo-password: gone2far ilo-user: Administrator mac-addr: 5C:B9:01:78:2D:00
Commit your configuration:cd ~/helion/hos/ansible git add -A git commit -m <"commit message">
Run the configuration processor:ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost config-processor-run.yml
Use the playbook below to create a deployment directory: ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost ready-deployment.yml
Verify that the node is removed from hosts/verb_hosts file.
